definition: scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
psychologist
physicist
geographer
pathologist
physiologist
astrophysicist
pinyin: tian1 ti3 wu4 li3 xue2 jia1

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理学家们对自己的学科都颇为自鸣得意。

sentences.english: One of the Meccas for the leading physicists of that time was in Gottingen.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候引导物理学家的麦加圣地之一，是哥廷根。

sentences.english: Psychologists could also identify the key ages that best allow for the memorization of classical texts.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家也可以帮助确定最适于记忆经典文本的年龄。

sentences.english: Social psychologists always are interested in inter-group behavior researches.
sentences.chinese: 群际行为研究一直是社会心理学家的兴趣所在。

sentences.english: Li Siguang is a famous geographer.
sentences.chinese: 李四光是一位著名的地理学家。

sentences.english: Psychologists and psychiatrists say that children should be handled with care.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家和精神病专家说孩子需要小心呵护。

sentences.english: To preserve the theory, physicists would have to make some changes. [Video: Dark Matter in 3-D]
sentences.chinese: 为了保持这个理论，物理学家就必须去做某些修改。

sentences.english: Thus, neurophysiologists tell us that lobsters do not process pain.
sentences.chinese: 但是，神经生理学家告诉我们龙虾感知不到疼痛。

sentences.english: This is what psychologists dream about at night.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家做梦也会梦到这些。

sentences.english: The successful physicist never puts on airs.
sentences.chinese: 这位卓有成就的物理学家从不搭架子。

sentences.english: The quote comes from this fairly well-known physicist.
sentences.chinese: 引自这位著名的物理学家。

sentences.english: Chenbaisha, who developed the neo-Confucianism here in Ming-dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明代理学家陈白沙也曾在此讲学。

sentences.english: As psychologists we have to question the natural.
sentences.chinese: 心理学家要对自然而然的反应提出疑问。

sentences.english: This sentence pattern is actually a favorite of psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个句型是心理学家最喜欢用的。

sentences.english: Spirited debates have erupted between physicists concerning these wormholes.
sentences.chinese: 之间爆发了热烈的争论，就这些虫洞物理学家。

sentences.english: I'm a geophysicist, and I've trained my students to find oil.
sentences.chinese: 我是地球物理学家，我培训我的学生们寻找石油。

definition: Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
Cheng Hao (1032-1085), Song neo-Confucian scholar
Cheng Yi (1033-1107), Song neo-Confucian scholar

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
thinker
Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073), Song dynasty neo-Confucian scholar
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
famous prime minister (in ancient China)/names and appearances (Buddhism)
writer/man of letters/CL:個|个[ge4]
Confucianism
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Wang Yangming (1472-1529), Ming dynasty Neo-Confucian philosopher, influential in the School of Mind 心學|心学[xin1 xue2]
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
